title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 7 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 7 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 7 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 7.

questions.question: What happened immediately after Solomon finished praying?
options: The fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering
The priests sang a hymn
The people left the temple
Solomon offered a prayer of thanksgiving
questions.correctAnswer: The fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:1 states that after Solomon finished praying, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices.

questions.question: Why could the priests not enter the house of the LORD after Solomon's prayer?
options: Because the glory of the LORD had filled the LORD'S house
Because the altar was full
Because the people blocked the entrance
Because the temple was under construction
questions.correctAnswer: Because the glory of the LORD had filled the LORD'S house
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:2 explains that priests could not enter because the glory of the LORD filled the house.

questions.question: What did the children of Israel do when they saw the fire and glory of the LORD?
options: They bowed themselves with their faces to the ground and worshipped
They ran away in fear
They sang loudly and danced
They built an altar outside
questions.correctAnswer: They bowed themselves with their faces to the ground and worshipped
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 7:3, the children of Israel bowed down, worshipped, and praised the LORD upon seeing the fire and glory.

questions.question: How many oxen did Solomon offer as a sacrifice during the dedication of the house of God?
options: Twenty-two thousand
Ten thousand
One hundred
Five thousand
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-two thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:5 states that Solomon offered 22,000 oxen as a sacrifice.

questions.question: Who played musical instruments to praise the LORD during the dedication of the house?
options: The Levites
The priests
The children of Israel
The king's servants
questions.correctAnswer: The Levites
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:6 says the Levites played instruments made by David to praise the LORD.

questions.question: Why did Solomon hallow the middle of the court before the house of the LORD?
options: Because the bronze altar could not hold all the offerings
Because there was no room inside the house
To build a new altar
To separate the priests from the people
questions.correctAnswer: Because the bronze altar could not hold all the offerings
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:7 explains Solomon hallowed the court because the altar could not receive all the burnt offerings and meat offerings.

questions.question: For how many days did Solomon keep the feast with all Israel?
options: Seven days
Three days
Fourteen days
One day
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:8 states Solomon kept the feast for seven days with all Israel.

questions.question: On which day did they make a solemn assembly to keep the dedication of the altar?
options: The eighth day
The first day
The seventh day
The tenth day
questions.correctAnswer: The eighth day
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:9 says on the eighth day they made a solemn assembly to conclude the dedication.

questions.question: How did the people feel when Solomon sent them away on the twenty-third day of the seventh month?
options: Glad and merry in heart
Sad and weary
Confused and silent
Angry and rebellious
questions.correctAnswer: Glad and merry in heart
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:10 records the people were glad and merry in heart when sent away.

questions.question: What did the LORD say to Solomon at night after the dedication?
options: I have heard thy prayer and chosen this place for a house of sacrifice
I will give you great riches
I will make your kingdom eternal
I will send a prophet to guide you
questions.correctAnswer: I have heard thy prayer and chosen this place for a house of sacrifice
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:12 states the LORD appeared to Solomon and said He heard his prayer and chose the place.

questions.question: True or False: If the people humble themselves and pray, the LORD will forgive their sins and heal their land.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:14 clearly states that if the people humble themselves, pray, and turn from wicked ways, the LORD will forgive and heal their land.

questions.question: True or False: God promised to always hear the prayers made in the house dedicated to Him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:15 says God's eyes and ears shall be open and attentive to prayers made in the place.

questions.question: True or False: God will cast out the house He sanctified if the people turn away and serve other gods.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:20 warns that if the people forsake God's statutes and worship other gods, He will cast out the sanctified house.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and ______, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways;'
options: pray
sing
fight
give offerings
questions.correctAnswer: pray
questions.explanation: The verse 2 Chronicles 7:14 includes 'and pray' as part of the condition for God to forgive and heal the land.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 7:18, what will God establish if Solomon walks before Him as David did?
options: The throne of Solomon's kingdom
A new temple
A great army
A lasting peace
questions.correctAnswer: The throne of Solomon's kingdom
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:18 promises that God will establish Solomon’s throne if he obeys His commands as David did.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 7 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 7 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is feeling overwhelmed and discouraged in prayer. Based on 2 Chronicles 7, what biblical truth would you share about God's response to sincere prayer?
options: God hears and responds to prayers made in His house
God ignores prayers during difficult times
Only priests’ prayers are heard by God
Prayer is unnecessary if God is silent
questions.correctAnswer: God hears and responds to prayers made in His house
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 7:12-15, the LORD said He has heard Solomon's prayer and will attentively listen to prayers made in the house He chose, promising to forgive and heal the land when His people humble themselves and pray.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 7 teach us about humility and repentance in the life of a believer?
options: Humbling, praying, seeking God, and turning from sin leads to forgiveness and healing
Repentance is optional if we are faithful in sacrifices
God will forgive without any change in behavior
Only public repentance matters, not personal
questions.correctAnswer: Humbling, praying, seeking God, and turning from sin leads to forgiveness and healing
questions.explanation: Verse 14 instructs that if God's people humble themselves, pray, seek His face, and turn from wicked ways, He will hear, forgive their sin, and heal their land, emphasizing the importance of true repentance.

questions.question: A believer is wondering about the importance of obedience to God's commands. What promise does 2 Chronicles 7 offer concerning obedience?
options: God will establish the throne of the obedient as He promised David
Obedience has no impact on God's blessings
Only sacrifices matter, not obedience
God rewards disobedience with success
questions.correctAnswer: God will establish the throne of the obedient as He promised David
questions.explanation: Verses 17-18 state that if Solomon walks before God as David did and obeys His commands, God will establish his kingdom according to His covenant with David, highlighting the blessing tied to obedience.

questions.question: What warning does 2 Chronicles 7 give about turning away from God's commandments?
options: God will uproot them from the land and reject the sanctified house
God will ignore their actions
They will be immediately forgiven without consequence
Only the priests will be punished
questions.correctAnswer: God will uproot them from the land and reject the sanctified house
questions.explanation: Verses 19-20 warn that if the people turn away and serve other gods, God will uproot them from the land and reject the house He sanctified, making it a proverb among nations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 7 illustrate the role of worship and praise in the life of God's people?
options: All Israel bowed down, worshipped, and praised the LORD for His goodness and enduring mercy
Worship was only for priests, not the people
Praise was unnecessary after sacrifices
Worship was done silently without music
questions.correctAnswer: All Israel bowed down, worshipped, and praised the LORD for His goodness and enduring mercy
questions.explanation: Verse 3 describes the children of Israel bowing with their faces to the ground, worshipping and praising the LORD, acknowledging His goodness and everlasting mercy, showing communal worship’s importance.

questions.question: In what way does 2 Chronicles 7 demonstrate the importance of dedication and celebration in spiritual life?
options: Solomon and Israel dedicated the house with sacrifices and kept a feast for seven days
Dedication was a one-time event with no celebration
Feasting was unrelated to worship
Only the king celebrated without the people
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon and Israel dedicated the house with sacrifices and kept a feast for seven days
questions.explanation: Verses 4-9 show Solomon and all Israel offering numerous sacrifices and celebrating the dedication of the altar with a seven-day feast and solemn assembly, emphasizing the joy in worship and dedication.

questions.question: A believer struggles with maintaining faithfulness in leadership roles. What encouragement does 2 Chronicles 7 offer regarding leadership integrity?
options: Walking faithfully before God leads to established and lasting leadership
Leadership is secure regardless of personal faithfulness
Integrity is only required in private, not public roles
God does not involve Himself in leadership matters
questions.correctAnswer: Walking faithfully before God leads to established and lasting leadership
questions.explanation: Verse 17 teaches that if Solomon walks before God as David did and obeys His commands, God will firmly establish his kingdom, showing the link between faithfulness and leadership stability.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 7, God's glory filled the house after Solomon finished praying.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 1 states that after Solomon ended his prayer, fire came down from heaven consuming the offerings, and the glory of the LORD filled the house, indicating God's presence.

questions.question: True or False: The priests were able to enter the house of the LORD after the glory filled it because they had special permission.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 2 clearly says the priests could not enter the house because the glory of the LORD had filled it, showing God's overwhelming presence.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 2 Chronicles 7:14, if God's people humble themselves, pray, seek His face, and _____ from their wicked ways, then He will hear from heaven.
options: turn
run
hide
ignore
questions.correctAnswer: turn
questions.explanation: Verse 14 specifies that turning from wicked ways is part of the condition for God to hear, forgive, and heal, highlighting repentance as essential.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 7 teach about God's ongoing presence in the place of worship?
options: God's eyes and heart shall be there perpetually in the chosen house
God only visits occasionally
God is distant and uninvolved in the temple
God prefers worship outside of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: God's eyes and heart shall be there perpetually in the chosen house
questions.explanation: Verse 16 explains that God chose and sanctified the house so that His name, eyes, and heart remain there forever, emphasizing His continual presence.

questions.question: A believer struggles with fear about consequences of sin in the church community. What does 2 Chronicles 7 say will happen if the people forsake God's commandments and worship other gods?
options: God will uproot them from the land and reject the sanctified house
God will overlook their actions
The community will prosper regardless
Only individual consequences occur, not communal
questions.correctAnswer: God will uproot them from the land and reject the sanctified house
questions.explanation: Verses 19-20 warn that turning from God and serving other gods will cause God to uproot the people and cast away the house He sanctified, making it a byword among nations.

questions.question: What example of worship music and praise is described in 2 Chronicles 7, and what does it teach about worship in the church?
options: Levites with instruments and priests sounding trumpets praised the LORD because His mercy endures forever
Music was forbidden in worship
Only silent prayer was allowed
Worship was done without instruments
questions.correctAnswer: Levites with instruments and priests sounding trumpets praised the LORD because His mercy endures forever
questions.explanation: Verse 6 describes Levites playing musical instruments made by David and priests sounding trumpets to praise God’s enduring mercy, illustrating joyful, musical worship as vital.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 7 demonstrate the importance of generosity and stewardship in dedicating the house of God?
options: King Solomon offered 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep as sacrifices
Only small offerings were needed
Sacrifices were symbolic with no real cost
The people gave nothing during the dedication
questions.correctAnswer: King Solomon offered 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep as sacrifices
questions.explanation: Verse 5 details Solomon’s large-scale sacrifices for the dedication, showing generous giving as part of honoring God and stewardship in worship.

questions.question: How can 2 Chronicles 7 guide a believer in dealing with trials and temptations?
options: Humility, prayer, and turning to God leads to healing and restoration
Ignoring God during trials is acceptable
Trials mean God has abandoned them
Only human effort is needed to overcome
questions.correctAnswer: Humility, prayer, and turning to God leads to healing and restoration
questions.explanation: Verses 13-15 teach that even in judgment or hardship, if God’s people humble themselves, pray, seek Him, and repent, God will hear and heal their land, offering hope in trials.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 7 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 7.

questions.question: What immediate sign demonstrated God's acceptance of Solomon's prayer at the dedication of the temple?
options: Fire came down from heaven
A mighty earthquake occurred
The temple doors opened by themselves
A voice spoke from the altar
questions.correctAnswer: Fire came down from heaven
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:1 states that after Solomon finished praying, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and sacrifices, signifying God's acceptance.

questions.question: Why were the priests unable to enter the temple after the fire came down?
options: Because the glory of the LORD filled the house
Because the temple was still under construction
They were performing a different ritual outside
They were overcome by smoke
questions.correctAnswer: Because the glory of the LORD filled the house
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:2 explains that the priests could not enter because the glory of the LORD filled the house, indicating God's overwhelming presence.

questions.question: How did the people of Israel respond when they saw the fire and the glory of the LORD upon the temple?
options: They bowed with their faces to the ground and praised the LORD
They shouted for joy and danced
They immediately left the temple area
They began to build altars outside
questions.correctAnswer: They bowed with their faces to the ground and praised the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:3 records that all the children of Israel bowed themselves with their faces to the ground, worshipped, and praised the LORD for His enduring mercy.

questions.question: What was the scale of sacrifices Solomon offered during the dedication of the temple?
options: 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep
10,000 oxen and 50,000 sheep
5,000 oxen and 30,000 sheep
50,000 oxen and 200,000 sheep
questions.correctAnswer: 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 7:5, Solomon offered a massive sacrifice of 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep to dedicate the house of God.

questions.question: What musical instruments accompanied the Levites during the temple dedication?
options: Instruments made by David to praise the LORD
Flutes and harps invented by Solomon
Drums and cymbals from Egypt
Trumpets and lyres made by the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Instruments made by David to praise the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:6 states that the Levites played instruments of music made by King David to praise the LORD because His mercy endures forever.

questions.question: Why did Solomon hallow the middle of the court before the temple?
options: Because the bronze altar could not receive all burnt offerings, meat offerings, and fat
To build a new altar for foreign gods
To establish a marketplace for offerings
To dedicate a place for sacrifices to David
questions.correctAnswer: Because the bronze altar could not receive all burnt offerings, meat offerings, and fat
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:7 explains that Solomon hallowed the middle of the court for burnt offerings and the fat of peace offerings as the bronze altar was not large enough.

questions.question: What geographical extent did the congregation cover during the seven days feast Solomon kept?
options: From entering Hamath to the river of Egypt
From Jerusalem to Babylon
From Mount Sinai to the Dead Sea
From Egypt to the Euphrates River
questions.correctAnswer: From entering Hamath to the river of Egypt
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:8 mentions that a great congregation from the entering of Hamath to the river of Egypt attended the feast.

questions.question: In the dedication of the altar, how long did the solemn assembly last according to the text?
options: One day on the eighth day
Seven days continuously
Three days with fasting
Fourteen days with celebrations
questions.correctAnswer: One day on the eighth day
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:9 states that on the eighth day they made a solemn assembly after the seven days dedication and feast.

questions.question: What covenantal condition did God set for Solomon to maintain the throne of his kingdom?
options: Walk before God as David walked and obey His commands
Offer daily sacrifices without fail
Build more altars in Israel
Expand the kingdom's territory beyond Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Walk before God as David walked and obey His commands
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:17-18 describes that if Solomon walks before God as David did and obeys God's statutes, God will establish his kingdom as promised.

questions.question: What consequence does God declare if the people forsake His statutes and serve other gods?
options: He will uproot them from the land and reject the temple
He will send prophets to warn them
He will reduce their harvests by half
He will allow foreign kings to conquer them
questions.correctAnswer: He will uproot them from the land and reject the temple
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:20 explains that forsaking God's laws and worshiping other gods will lead to being plucked up from the land and the temple being cast out of sight.

questions.question: What reason is given for God bringing evil upon the land and the temple?
options: Because the people forsook the LORD God and worshipped other gods
Because the temple was not built according to the law
Because Solomon did not offer enough sacrifices
Because the priests failed to maintain purity
questions.correctAnswer: Because the people forsook the LORD God and worshipped other gods
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:22 states that the evil came because the people abandoned the LORD God and served other gods.

questions.question: What does God promise to do when His people humble themselves, pray, seek His face, and turn from wicked ways?
options: Hear from heaven, forgive their sin, and heal their land
Send an angel to guide them
Grant them immediate wealth and peace
Remove the temple as a place of worship
questions.correctAnswer: Hear from heaven, forgive their sin, and heal their land
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:14 promises that if the people humble themselves and repent, God will hear, forgive, and heal their land.

questions.question: What is the significance of God's eyes and heart being perpetually in the temple?
options: It signifies God’s continuous presence and care for the temple
It means the temple is a fortress against enemies
It shows that the temple is a place for secret rituals
It indicates the temple’s future destruction
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies God’s continuous presence and care for the temple
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:16 notes that God chose and sanctified the house so His eyes and heart would always be there, indicating ongoing divine presence.

questions.question: True or False: The dedication of the temple included a feast that lasted fourteen days in total.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The dedication and feast each lasted seven days as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 7:9, totaling fourteen days, but the solemn assembly was on the eighth day, not the entire fourteen days as a feast.

questions.question: Which Old Testament king is repeatedly referenced in 2 Chronicles 7 as the model for Solomon's obedience?
options: David
Saul
Hezekiah
Josiah
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:17 refers to David as the example for Solomon to walk before God and obey His commands.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 7 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 7 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What event demonstrated God's acceptance of Solomon's prayer at the dedication of the temple?
options: Fire came down from heaven and consumed the sacrifices
A great earthquake shook the temple
A voice spoke from the temple roof
Solomon received a prophetic vision
questions.correctAnswer: Fire came down from heaven and consumed the sacrifices
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 7:1 records that after Solomon finished praying, fire came down from heaven to consume the burnt offerings, confirming God's acceptance. This divine fire affirms God's presence as seen also in Leviticus 9:24 and 1 Kings 18:38. Jesus referred to God's sovereign power over fire in Luke 12:49, and Hebrews 12:29 speaks about God being a consuming fire.

questions.question: Why were the priests unable to enter the house of the LORD after the dedication?
options: Because the glory of the LORD filled the house
Because the temple was sealed by Solomon
Because a plague struck the priests
Because the altar was not yet consecrated
questions.correctAnswer: Because the glory of the LORD filled the house
questions.explanation: Verse 2 explains that the priests could not enter because the glory of the LORD filled the temple, indicating God's overwhelming presence. This parallels God’s glory filling the tabernacle in Exodus 40:34-35 and the cloud filling Solomon’s temple in 1 Kings 8:10-11. The New Testament also speaks of God's glory filling believers in 2 Corinthians 3:18.

questions.question: How did the children of Israel respond when they saw the fire and the glory of the LORD upon the house?
options: They bowed down and worshipped, praising the LORD
They ran away in fear and confusion
They began to build another altar
They sang a new song but did not worship
questions.correctAnswer: They bowed down and worshipped, praising the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 3 records that the people bowed with their faces to the ground and worshipped, praising God for His goodness and enduring mercy. This act of worship aligns with Old Testament patterns of reverence (Psalm 95:6), the response to God’s glory (Habakkuk 2:20), and New Testament exhortations to worship in spirit and truth (John 4:24).

questions.question: What quantity of animals did Solomon offer as sacrifices during the dedication of the temple?
options: Twenty-two thousand oxen and one hundred and twenty thousand sheep
Ten thousand oxen and fifty thousand sheep
One thousand oxen and ten thousand sheep
Fifty thousand oxen and two hundred thousand sheep
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-two thousand oxen and one hundred and twenty thousand sheep
questions.explanation: Verse 5 specifies the massive number of sacrifices Solomon offered, emphasizing the solemnity and grandeur of the dedication. Sacrificial practices are foundational in Levitical worship (Leviticus 1-7). The New Testament reveals Christ as the ultimate perfect sacrifice (Hebrews 10:1-14).

questions.question: Which musical instruments and ministry did the Levites perform during the temple dedication?
options: Instruments of music made by David to praise the LORD
Flutes and tambourines invented by Solomon
Harp and lyre composed by Aaron
Drums and cymbals brought from Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Instruments of music made by David to praise the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states the Levites used musical instruments created by David to praise God, highlighting the continuity of worship traditions. Psalm 150 praises God with various instruments. The New Testament also encourages singing and worship with music (Ephesians 5:19).

questions.question: Why did Solomon hallow the middle of the court before the temple?
options: Because the bronze altar could not hold all the burnt offerings and meat offerings
Because the priests needed a place to rest
Because the people wanted a separate place for worship
Because it was the only clean area available
questions.correctAnswer: Because the bronze altar could not hold all the burnt offerings and meat offerings
questions.explanation: According to verse 7, Solomon consecrated the central court to accommodate the large number of offerings that the bronze altar could not contain. This shows God's provision for adequate worship space, consistent with the attention to sacrificial details in Leviticus 1-7. Jesus referenced the altar's importance in His cleansing of the temple (John 2:13-17).

questions.question: How long did Solomon keep the feast and dedication of the altar?
options: Seven days for the feast and seven days for the dedication
Three days for the feast and three days for the dedication
Fourteen days for the feast only
One day for both the feast and dedication
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days for the feast and seven days for the dedication
questions.explanation: Verses 8 and 9 indicate Solomon celebrated the feast for seven days and the altar's dedication for another seven days, reflecting the biblical pattern of seven-day festivals (Exodus 23:16; Leviticus 23). Jesus observed Jewish festivals (Luke 2:41-42), affirming their theological significance.

questions.question: What was the emotional state of the people when Solomon sent them back to their homes after the dedication?
options: Glad and merry in heart
Weary and sorrowful
Silent and contemplative
Angry and rebellious
questions.correctAnswer: Glad and merry in heart
questions.explanation: Verse 10 shows the people left joyfully, celebrating God's goodness to David, Solomon, and Israel. This joy aligns with biblical themes of rejoicing in God's blessings (Psalm 126:2; Nehemiah 8:10). The New Testament also encourages rejoicing in God's salvation (Philippians 4:4).

questions.question: What promise did God give Solomon regarding the house He had chosen and sanctified?
options: That His eyes and heart would be there perpetually
That the temple would never be destroyed
That Solomon would live forever
That the temple would be the only place of worship
questions.correctAnswer: That His eyes and heart would be there perpetually
questions.explanation: Verse 16 states God chose and sanctified the house so His eyes and heart would always be there, signifying God's ongoing presence. This echoes God's covenant promises (2 Samuel 7:16) and points to the presence of God with His people (John 14:23).

questions.question: What condition must Solomon fulfill to have the throne of his kingdom established according to God's covenant?
options: Walk before God as David did and obey His commandments
Build more altars across Israel
Offer more sacrifices than David
Gather armies to defend Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Walk before God as David did and obey His commandments
questions.explanation: Verse 17 teaches that obedience and faithful walking with God, like David, are conditions for the stability of Solomon’s throne, reflecting the covenantal principle of blessing upon obedience (Deuteronomy 28). Jesus is the fulfillment of this royal obedience (Hebrews 1:8).

questions.question: What consequence did God declare if the people forsook His statutes and served other gods?
options: He would uproot them from the land and reject the temple
He would send a flood to destroy the land
He would make them rulers over other nations
He would bless their new gods
questions.correctAnswer: He would uproot them from the land and reject the temple
questions.explanation: Verses 19-20 warn that turning away to other gods will result in being uprooted from the land and the temple being cast out of God’s sight. This reflects the covenant curses in Deuteronomy 28 and the prophetic warnings (Jeremiah 7:14). Jesus affirmed that idolatry leads to separation from God (Matthew 6:24).

questions.question: How does God describe the house if it becomes a byword and proverb among the nations?
options: An astonishment to everyone passing by
A monument of peace and prosperity
A refuge for all nations
A place of silence and solitude
questions.correctAnswer: An astonishment to everyone passing by
questions.explanation: Verse 21 states the house will be an astonishment, causing people to wonder why God allowed such judgment, highlighting the consequences of covenant unfaithfulness. This theme is found in Ezekiel 39:23 and Isaiah 37:27. Jesus alluded to God's judgment on unrepentant Israel (Luke 19:43-44).

questions.question: According to God, why does He bring evil upon the land and the house?
options: Because the people forsook God and worshipped other gods
Because the priests neglected sacrifices
Because Solomon built a temple too large
Because the people did not fast enough
questions.correctAnswer: Because the people forsook God and worshipped other gods
questions.explanation: Verse 22 clearly states that the evil comes because the people abandoned the LORD and served other gods, a recurring biblical theme of covenant violation leading to judgment (Exodus 32, Judges 2). Jesus warns of the dangers of idolatry (1 John 5:21).

questions.question: What does God say He will do if His people humble themselves, pray, seek His face, and turn from wicked ways?
options: He will hear, forgive their sin, and heal their land
He will send more prophets
He will remove the temple
He will make them conquer their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: He will hear, forgive their sin, and heal their land
questions.explanation: Verse 14 promises forgiveness and healing upon repentance and prayer, illustrating God's mercy and readiness to restore, consistent with Isaiah 55:7, Psalm 103:12, and the teaching of Jesus on forgiveness (Luke 15:7).

questions.question: In what manner did God appear to Solomon after the temple was built?
options: By night, confirming He heard Solomon's prayer
In a pillar of fire by day
Through an angel with a flaming sword
In a thunderstorm with lightning
questions.correctAnswer: By night, confirming He heard Solomon's prayer
questions.explanation: Verse 12 states that the LORD appeared to Solomon by night, affirming His acceptance of Solomon’s prayer and choosing of the temple. This theophany resembles other divine appearances at night (Genesis 28:12; Judges 6:11) and prefigures the revelation of Christ as Light in darkness (John 1:5).
